snippet: Not one Republican showed the courage to break ranks and speak up for the disclosure of campaign finance donors.
abstract: Editorial condemns Senate Republicans for filibustering and unanimously rejecting a bill that would enact stronger campaign finance disclosure regulations in accordance with a Supreme Court recommendation in the otherwise disastrous 2010 Citizens United ruling; notes that Republicans have been the main beneficiaries of unprecedented corporate and independent spending sprees, which explains their efforts to kill disclosure.
lead_paragraph: Not one Republican showed the courage to break ranks and speak up for the disclosure of campaign finance donors.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
